This kind of genetic manipulation can create unpredictable effects, including the production of new proteins that the human body may not recognize or tolerate.

3. **They say that GMOs have been consumed for decades without evidence of harm.**  
   That argument is based on a false assumption: absence of evidence is not the same as evidence of absence. We simply don’t have enough long-term data on GMO consumption in humans. Chronic diseases like cancer, autoimmune disorders, and gut-related conditions take years or even decades to manifest. Many of these illnesses are on the rise at the same time that GMOs have become widespread in the food supply. Correlation does not prove causation, but it certainly raises questions that deserve serious investigation.

For example, some studies have found that GMO crops can produce higher levels of certain toxins or allergens. Just because a food looks the same on paper doesn’t mean it behaves the same way in the body.
